titleStmt.title: The faerie leveller, or, King Charles his leveller descried and deciphered in Queene Elizabeths dayes by her poet laureat Edmond Spenser, in his unparaleld poeme entituled, The faerie qveene, a lively representation of our times.

titleStmt.title: The faerie leveller, or, King Charles his leveller descried and deciphered in Queene Elizabeths dayes by her poet laureat Edmond Spenser, in his unparaleld poeme entituled, The faerie qveene, a lively representation of our times.

notesStmt.note: An extract from The faerie queene, book 5, canto 2, stanzas 29-54, with a preface identifying Artegal with King Charles, the giant leveller with Cromwell, etc.--NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Place of publication suggested by NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
